Models¶

Cosmos Models¶

Models

class cosmos.models.GaussianSpot(target, drift, D)[source]¶

Bases: torch.nn.modules.module.Module

Calculates ideal shape of the 2D-Gaussian spot given spot parameters, target positions, and drift list.

\(\dfrac{h_{knf}}{2 \pi w^2_{nfk}} \exp{\left ( -\dfrac{(i-x_{nfk})^2 + (j-y_{nfk})^2}{2w^2_{nfk}} \right)}\)

Parameters

  • target – AoI target positions.

  • drift – Frame drift list.

forward(height, width, x, y, n_idx, f_idx)[source]¶
Parameters

  • height – integrated spot intensity.

  • width – width of the 2D-Gaussian spot.

  • x – relative \(x\)-axis position relative to the target.

  • y – relative \(y\)-axis position relative to the target.

  • n_idx – AoI indices.

  • f_idx – Frame indices.

Returns

Ideal shape 2D-Gaussian spot.

Return type

Categorical

training: bool¶
class cosmos.models.Model(S, K=2)[source]¶

Bases: torch.nn.modules.module.Module

Base class for cosmos models.

Implementing New Models:

Derived models must implement the methods model() guide()

save_checkpoint()[source]¶
load_checkpoint(path=None)[source]¶
load_parameters(path=None)[source]¶
snr()[source]¶

Calculate the signal-to-noise ratio.

Total signal:

\(\mu_{knf} = \sum_{ij} I_{nfij} \mathcal{N}(i, j \mid x_{knf}, y_{knf}, w_{knf})\)

Noise:

\(\sigma^2_{knf} = \sigma^2_{\text{offset}} + \mu_{knf} \text{gain}\)

Signal-to-noise ratio:

\(\text{SNR}_{knf} = \dfrac{\mu_{knf} - b_{nf} - \mu_{\text{offset}}}{\sigma_{knf}} \text{ for } \theta_{nf} = k\)

training: bool¶
